answers.answer: They definitely don't do an elective induction with a first baby unless there is a medical issue with the mama like preeclampsia or an issue with the baby.  First time moms that are induced have a higher rate of c sections so docs will let them go way beyond a 'due date'.  I went 10 days over.My second child they induced a week early at 39 weeks.  The 'official' cause was a large baby although it was really a matter of my doctor and I getting along really well, her knowing I had a 1 year old at home and it was easier to plan the labor than to wait for it to happen and if we planned it, she'd be sure to be the doctor on call.good luck

I had an induction with my first and like said before I had high blood pressure and they wanted to monitor me and the baby. And also like said before I had to have a c - section. And it ***** I was so disappointed I felt like my body failed me.

question: Would most doctor do on elective induction before due date?
title: question.
